meanings: Adjective 英, 비격식 (아주 나쁨·짜증스러움을 나타내어) 순[완전한] (=complete)

vlive.korean: [서로가 서로의 빙고판 극혐] 이거 40! [Hating each other's Bingo plate] This... 40! 듣기 View video NU'EST : [NU'EST] L.O.Λ.E STORY EP.19 뉴이스트의 2020 왁자지껄 운수대통 #1
감탄사, 단어? 이건 서로 얘기해 주면 되지 않을까요? An exclamation or word? We can answer that for each other. 듣기 View video OSEN : PENTAGON 펜타곤, 귀여운 2인 1조 TMI 인터뷰 #스타로드 05
vlive.english: An exclamation or word? We can answer that for each other.

vlive.korean: 맞아요 - '너도 굿 드림' 뭐 이렇게 - 서로 굿 드림? That's right. - "You should also have a good dream." Like this. - Good dreams to one another? 듣기 View video NU'EST : 뉴이스트와 스푼즈가 함께하는 Special V LIVE [THE NU'STORE]
vlive.english: That's right. - "You should also have a good dream." Like this. - Good dreams to one another?

vlive.korean: 서로 통하는? Something that we connect? 듣기 View video ITZY : 류진이의 왓어원더풀나잇💙
'서로 싸운적 있어요?' "Have you two fought before?" 듣기 View video (G)I-DLE : 🐭🦒

examples.korean: We cuddled up together under the blanket. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 우리는 담요를 덮고 서로 바싹 붙어 누워 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We cuddled up together under the blanket. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Rival fans hurled abuse at each other. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 경쟁 팀의 팬들이 서로에게 욕설을 퍼부었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Rival fans hurled abuse at each other. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They were flinging insults at each other. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 서로 모욕적인 말들을 퍼붓고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They were flinging insults at each other. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They looked at each other with distrust. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 불신감을 갖고 서로를 쳐다보았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They looked at each other with distrust. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They were irresistibly drawn to each other. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 거부할 수 없을 정도로 서로에게 끌렸다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They were irresistibly drawn to each other. Add to Wordbook
